abstract: Cordoba Journal; Cordoba, the second-largest city in Argentina, has long boasted of reputation for rebelliousness and distinctive culture, whether in politics, music or its famous penchant for Fernet liqueur mixed with Coca-Cola; rebellious attitude is in part aimed at distinguishing itself from Buenos Aires.
lead_paragraph: Residents of Córdoba, a city of 1.3 million in the interior, pride themselves on doing things differently from their countrymen — even at the bar.

headline.main: Argentine City Aims to Stand Out With Rebellious Spirit (and Coke) in a Cup
headline.print_headline: For a Taste of Argentine City’s Rebellious Spirit, Add a Splash of Coke

snippet: Residents of Córdoba, a city of 1.3 million in the interior, pride themselves on doing things differently from their countrymen — even at the bar.
